subject: Programming
title: Mental Models in Programming
description: A quick win: understand Mental Models in Programming.

hook.text: Every programmer builds an invisible mental model of the code. When the model is wrong, bugs appear.

buildup.text: A mental model is your internal simulation of how the program works ‚Äî variables, flow, and state.

discovery.text: Expert programmers hold richer, more accurate models. They 'see' the code running in their heads.

twist.text: Complex code breaks mental models. When you can't hold the whole picture, mistakes become inevitable.

climax.text: Clean code succeeds because it builds accurate mental models quickly in the reader's mind.

punchline.text: Code is only as good as the model it creates.

quiz.question: Why do expert programmers have fewer bugs?
options: They hold richer mental models of the code
